statement.tex: \text{Find the area contained between the curves}\\ \qquad y=\dfrac{x^2}{2}\text{ and } y = \dfrac{1}{1+x^2}

step.context: \text{What do the two curves look like?}

step.tex: \text{The points where the two curves intersect}
\text{The points where the two curves cut}\\ \text{the y-axis}
step.reason: \text{The required area lies between the two points}\\ \text{where the curves intersect. Hence, find those first.}

step.tex: \text{The two curves intersect when }\\ y=\dfrac{x^2}{2}=\dfrac{1}{1+x^2}\implies x^4+x^2-2 = 0\\ \text{If }z=x^2,\text{ then } z^2+z-2 = 0 \\ \implies (z-1)\cdot (z+2) = 0\implies z = x^2 = 1,-2\\ \text{But as }x^2\geq 0, x^2 = 1\implies x = \pm 1

\text{The two curves intersect when }\\ y=\dfrac{x^2}{2}=\dfrac{1}{1+x^2}\implies x^4-x^2-2 = 0\\ \text{If }z=x^2,\text{ then } z^2-z-2 = 0 \\ \implies (z-2)\cdot (z+1) = 0\implies z = x^2 = -1,2\\ \text{But as }x^2\geq 0, x^2 = 2\implies x = \pm\sqrt{2}
